result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sang Cuan in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Sang Cuan.  Assistant District Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

SAI:  Dawt Hlei Tlai:  Hakha Chin Interpreter  Defense is requesting a motion hearing date and dates for Final Pre Trial and Jury Trial in Br 45.  mn
Pretrial SUPERVISION Report 10_20_2022, Filed.

No appearances.  Re: Justice Point violation.  This clerk sent an email to Attorney Cherella noting the Judges' request for him to contact a Haka Chin interpreter to advise his client to comply with justice point.
Pretrial Services Noncompliance Report 9-27-2022, Filed

Sworn as Interpreter:  Dawt Tial - to interpret Hakha Chin language.  The Court questioned interpreter as she is not a certified interpreter for Court proceedings.  Statements made by parties.  The Court finds the interpreter is qualified for this hearing.

Defendant Sang Cuan in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Sang Cuan.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties before the Court for defense motion to suppress.   Statements made by defense and state.  For reasons as stated on the record, the Court DENIED defense motion.  Defense requests an adjourned date for scheduling.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Substantive Jury Instructions, Filed.
Defense Motion to Dismiss, Filed.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court finds the State has complied with Victim/Witness Notification.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $8,500.00.  Court ordered all non-monetary conditions to remain the same:  Level 5 Supervision; NO Contact with EIB,GL,BP & NS.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for motion hearing.  mn

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court, defendant Sang Cuan not in court, in custody, appearance waived.   Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a Motion to Dismiss due to lack of probable cause.  The defense is to file motion by 8/12/22, if the State chooses to file reply/response, the deadline for filing is 8/19/22.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 07-27-22 by DANIELLE HOLCOMB.

Defendant Sang Cuan in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Defendant Sang Cuan in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Sang Par. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Officer M. Paro. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defense given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date and to be heard on bail on the next date.     
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court by video, defendant Sang Cuan not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 7/7/2022 at 8:30am. Defense Counsel will not be available that date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
